column5: We take our own groceries with us when we go to Canada and we know we can't take potatoes or worms in dirt. We usually take individually packaged frozen steaks with us for our last night up there we have surf and turf, but someone told me that we can't take any kind of beef over the border this year. Is this true and is tehre a site where I can read up on what groceries we can and can't take into Canada, we want to remain legal Thanks
[font color=green size=3][b]Schroll down here: http://www.cbsa-asfc.gc.ca/E/pub/cp/...html#P141_4348 You can take about 10lbs per person for your own consumtion.
